info.question: Elastic Beanstalk supports which four deployment policies
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy deploys the new version to all instances simultaneously
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy has all of your instances are out of service while the deployment takes place
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that you will experience an outage while the deployment is taking place - not ideal for mission-critical production systems
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that if the update fails, you need to roll back the changes by re-deploying the original version to all your instances
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policies deploy the new version in batches
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that each batch of instances is taken out of service while the deployment takes place
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy is not ideal for performance sensitive systems
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that if the update fails, you need to perform an additional rolling update to roll back the changes
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy launches an additional batch of instances
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy maintains full capacity during the deployment process
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that if the update fails, you need to perform an additional update to roll back the changes
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy deploys the new version to a fresh group of instances in their own new auto-scaling group

Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that when the new instances pass their health checks, they are moved to your existing auto-scaling group, and finally, the old instances are terminated
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy works so that the impact of a failed update is far less, and the rollback process requires only terminating the new auto-scaling group
Which Elastic Beanstalk deployment policy is preferred option for mission-critical production systems
You can customize your elastic beanstalk environment using Elastic Beanstalk ______
Elastic Beanstalk configuration files can contain or do which of these?
Elastic Beanstalk configuration files are written in which of these?
Elastic Beanstalk configuration files must have the ______ file extension?
Elastic Beanstalk configuration files must be saved in folder called?
Elastic Beanstalk .ebextensions folder must be in the ______
answers: top-level directory of your application source code bundle
src directory of your application source code bundle
public directory of your application source code bundle
config directory of your application source code bundle
correctAnswer: top-level directory of your application source code bundle

info.question: Elastic Beanstalk supports which two ways of integrating an RDS database with your Beanstalk environment?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration means the RDS instance is created within your Elastic Beanstalk environment?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration means means the lifecycle of your database is tied to the lifecycle of your application environment, if you terminate the environment the database instance will also be terminated?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration decouples the RDS instance from your Elastic Beanstalk environment?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration allows you to connect multiple environments to the same database?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration provides a wider choice of database types?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: Which Elastic Beanstalk type of RDS database instance integration allows you to tear down your application environment without affecting the database instance?
answers: Launch both inside and outside Elastic Beanstalk

info.question: To allow the EC2 instances in your Elastic Beanstalk environment to connect to an outside database you have to do which of these steps?
answers: must add an additional security group to your environments auto-scaling group
you will need to provide connection string configuration information to your application servers (endpoint, user name, password) using Elastic Beanstalk environment properties
you will need to add additional IAM policies and rules to your environment
configure your EC2 instances to connect to the RDS instance
correctAnswer: must add an additional security group to your environments auto-scaling group
you will need to provide connection string configuration information to your application servers (endpoint, user name, password) using Elastic Beanstalk environment properties

SNS messages cannot be customized by protocol type

You have been asked to decouple an application by utilizing SQS. The application dictates that messages on the queue can be delivered more than once, but must be delivered in the order that they have arrived, and also must allow for efficient, repeated polling of the queue. Which of the following options are most suitable?
answers: Configure a standard SQS queue and use long polling
Configure a FIFO SQS queue and enable long polling
Configure a FIFO SQS queue and enable short polling
Configure a standard SQS queue and use default polling
correctAnswer: Configure a FIFO SQS queue and enable long polling

info.question: You have a list of email addresses to which you need to push emails on a periodic basis. What do you subscribe them to?
You can use SNS in conjunction with SQS to fan a single message out to multiple SQS queues
SQS was the first service on the AWS platform?
You have a fleet of EC2 instances that are constantly polling empty SQS queues, burning CPU cycles and costing your company money. What should you do?
answers: Delete the entire EC2 fleet so that they no longer poll the queue
Consider using ElastiCache to cache the messages, rather than SQS

info.question: You run a video-hosting website with two types of members: premium, fee-paying members; and free members. Each video that is uploaded is processed by a fleet of EC2 instances, which poll an SQS queue as videos are uploaded. However, you need to ensure that the videos uploaded by your premium, fee-paying members have a higher priority than those of your free members. How might you work with SQS to endure priority treatment of the premium members videos?
answers: SQS allows you to set priorities on individual items within the queue, so simply set the fee paying members at a higher priority than your free members
SQS would not be suitable for this scenario. It would be much better to use SNS to encode the videos
Create two SQS queues — one for premium members, and one for free members. Program your EC2 fleet to poll the premium queue first and, if empty, to then poll your free members SQS queue.
correctAnswer: Create two SQS queues — one for premium members, and one for free members. Program your EC2 fleet to poll the premium queue first and, if empty, to then poll your free members SQS queue.

info.question: AWS provides a number of security related managed services. From the options below, select which AWS service is related to protecting your infrastructure from which security issue. (Choose 4)
answers: AWS Shield protects from SQL Injection attacks
AWS WAF protects from Cross Site Scripting attacks
Amazon Macie uses Machine Learning to protect sensitive data
AWS WAF blocks IP addresses based on rules
AWS Shield protects from Distributed Denial of Service attacks
correctAnswer: AWS WAF protects from Cross Site Scripting attacks
Amazon Macie uses Machine Learning to protect sensitive data
AWS WAF blocks IP addresses based on rules
AWS Shield protects from Distributed Denial of Service attacks

info.question: What is the maximum retention period for an SQS message?
Which Amazon service can you use in conjunction with SQS to fan out SQS messages to multiple queues?
Unlike Cloud Formation, the use of Elastic Beanstalk is not free. And, in addition, you must pay for the resources it provisions.

You are designing a new application that processes payments and delivers promotional emails to customers. You need to ensure that the payment process takes priority over the creation and delivery of emails. How might you use SQS to achieve this.
answers: Use 1 SQS queue for the platform. Use the SetPriority API call to ensure that all payment SQS messages take priority over the promotional email messages.
Use 1 SQS queue for the platform. Use the HighPriority API call to ensure that all payment SQS messages take priority over the promotional email messages.
Use 2 SQS queues for the platform. Have the EC2 fleet poll the payment SQS queue first. If this queue is empty, then poll the promotional emails queue.
Use 2 SQS queues for the platform. Have the EC2 fleet poll the promotional emails SQS queue first. If this queue is empty, then poll the payment emails queue.
correctAnswer: Use 2 SQS queues for the platform. Have the EC2 fleet poll the payment SQS queue first. If this queue is empty, then poll the promotional emails queue.
